name: The Sound of Water
text:
The Sound of Water
Horatio Gargonath

I have tasted the clear
I have whispered in its ear
I have called upon the water
And seen it break upon the rocks

Have you heard the water calling?
Have you felt the gentle lapping?
Swirling at your feet
Have you seen the river twisting?
And turning, so sweet

Crystal-clear water
Writhing and churning
Turned black and murky
Then crystal again

Have you heard the water calling?
Have you felt the gentle lapping?
Swirling at your feet
Have you seen the river twisting?
And turning, so sweet

I have felt the water rising
Up from the briny deep
I have heard the water rushing
And pushing at my feet

The water, so clear
Like a crystal, held dear
The water, so wonderful
Like a caress, so gentle?
